similar_tickets_found.TITLE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>

>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”

>
>

> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

>

new_ticket.name: Rohan Kulkarni
new_ticket.description:
Please share the edited draft by *next Friday* so we can proceed with
publishing.
Regards,
Editorial Team
new_ticket.title: Final Edits Required

extracted_metadata.user_actions: Trying to publish the edited draft

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Open your web browser and navigate to the publishing system's login page.
2. Enter your credentials to log in to the publishing system.
3. Locate the edited draft that you are trying to publish.
4. Open the draft and carefully review it to ensure all final edits have been made.
5. Once you are satisfied with the content, look for a "Publish" or "Submit for Review" button within the publishing system interface.
6. Click on the "Publish" or "Submit for Review" button to initiate the publishing process.
7. If prompted for confirmation, review the action and confirm that you want to proceed with publishing the draft.
8. After successfully publishing the draft, you should receive a confirmation message or see the updated status of the draft.
9. If you encounter any issues during the process, please gather relevant details and contact IT support for further assistance.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Dan,

If this is about Jerry Thompson, I sent an email in that other thread. Jim
got and opened the email notification for the LOI being signed.

If it helps, we can set up an automation to email Jim and/or anyone else if
these email notifications have been opened and the agent's stage hasn't
been changed within a certain time frame.

If this is about another agent, please let me know so I can investigate it.

Travis Schenck

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.name: Rohan Kulkarni
new_ticket.description:
-

   Please complete the code review by *tomorrow*.
   Thanks,
   Dev Team
new_ticket.title: Code Review
new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Identify the code that needs to be reviewed. This could be a specific file or set of files you have been working on.
2. Notify the appropriate person or team responsible for conducting code reviews in your organization about the overdue review. You can do this via email, instant messaging, or any other preferred communication method.
3. Clearly communicate the urgency level as "high" in your message, so they understand the importance of prioritizing this task.
4. Include the relevant code snippets or links to the code repository in your message to make it easy for the reviewer to access and assess the code.
5. Politely request the reviewer to complete the code review as soon as possible, keeping in mind the high urgency level.
6. Once the reviewer has provided their feedback, make any necessary changes to the code based on their comments and suggestions.
7. After addressing the feedback, kindly ask the reviewer to double-check the code to ensure all issues have been resolved.
8. Once the reviewer confirms that the code is ready, proceed to merge or implement the changes in the appropriate system.
9. Document the completed code review process, including the timeline, reviewer's feedback, and any changes made, for future reference.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

new_ticket.title: Delivery Schedule

extracted_metadata.user_actions: Trying to ensure delivery by a specific date
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Verify delivery schedule and confirm with vendor

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Log in to the delivery system with your credentials.
2. Navigate to the "Schedule" section of the delivery system.
3. Locate the delivery that you are trying to ensure by a specific date.
4. Check the current schedule for this delivery. Make note of the expected delivery date.
5. If the current schedule does not meet your desired delivery date, proceed to the next step.
6. Identify the vendor responsible for this delivery.
7. Contact the vendor directly to discuss the delivery schedule. You may need to provide them with the delivery ID or other relevant information.
8. Explain your desired delivery date to the vendor and inquire if they can accommodate this request.
9. Wait for the vendor's confirmation. They may provide you with a revised delivery schedule.
10. Once you have received confirmation from the vendor, update the delivery schedule in the delivery system accordingly.
11. Monitor the delivery status regularly to ensure it remains on track for your desired delivery date.

Please note that the technical keywords in the metadata do not seem to correspond to any specific troubleshooting steps. They may be related to the error messages or other aspects of the issue, but without further context, they cannot be directly applied to the resolution process.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

MARKETING STRATEGIST
 <https://www.mybizniche.com/>
www.mybizniche.com
Direct: 480-351-7071 <4803517071>
Office: 480-977-6444 <4809776444>
TravisSchenck@mybizniche.com <travisschenck@mybizniche.com>
16100 N. Greenway-Hayden Loop,
Ste F150, Scottsdale, AZ 85260



On Wed, Sep 18, 2024 at 2:39?PM Dan Garzella <dan@garzellagroup.com> wrote:

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>
>
> “Letter of Intent Signed”
>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”
>
> “Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”
>
>
>
> In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative
> would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in
> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.
>
>
>
> @Carly Garzella <carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.
>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
>

new_ticket.name: Rohan Kulkarni
new_ticket.description:
Let’s catch up sometime next week. No deadline on this, just whenever
convenient.
Cheers,
Manager
new_ticket.title: Team Catch-up

extracted_metadata.affected_system: None (no system or application is affected)
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: No specific resolution approach or common fix mentioned

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Schedule a team catch-up by finding a suitable time for all team members to meet.
2. Choose an appropriate communication method for the catch-up, such as a video conferencing tool, phone call, or in-person meeting.
3. Prepare an agenda for the catch-up, including topics to discuss and any necessary materials to share with the team.
4. Distribute the agenda and any relevant materials to team members ahead of time, so they can prepare for the meeting.
5. During the catch-up, encourage open communication and active participation from all team members.
6. Take notes on important points, action items, and decisions made during the meeting.
7. After the catch-up, share the notes with the team and ensure everyone is aware of their action items and next steps.

new_ticket.name: Anant
new_ticket.description: My headphones are not working need replacement
new_ticket.title: Hardware issue
new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Check the connection of your headphones to the device. Make sure they are properly plugged in.
2. Try using your headphones on a different device to see if they work. This will help you determine if the issue is with the headphones or the device.
3. If the headphones still don't work, try resetting them. The method to do this varies by brand and model, so consult your user manual or the manufacturer's website for instructions.
4. If resetting doesn't work, you may need to replace the headphones. If they are still under warranty, contact the manufacturer for a replacement. If not, you can purchase a new pair from a trusted retailer.
5. If you prefer to try and repair the headphones yourself, you can look up DIY repair guides online. However, this may void your warranty and could potentially damage the headphones further if not done correctly.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

>
>
>

Kindly ensure delivery by *07/05/2025*.

Vendor Management
new_ticket.title: Delivery Schedule

extracted_metadata.user_actions: Trying to ensure delivery by a specific date
extracted_metadata.resolution_indicators: Verify delivery schedule and confirm with vendor

new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Log in to the delivery system with your credentials.
2. Navigate to the "Delivery Schedule" section of the system.
3. Locate the delivery that you are trying to ensure by a specific date.
4. Check the current schedule for this delivery. Look for any potential conflicts or issues that might prevent it from being on time.
5. If you find any issues, make a note of them.
6. Contact your vendor to discuss the delivery schedule and any issues you have found. Provide them with the notes you made in step 5.
7. Confirm with the vendor whether the delivery can be made by the specific date you need.
8. Update the delivery schedule in the system with the new information provided by the vendor.
9. Monitor the delivery progress regularly to ensure it stays on track for the updated date.

If you continue to experience issues, please escalate the ticket to a higher level of support.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

We can’t have this, and we can’t seem to get it right which is very frustrating.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Please review and advise.

Best Regards,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck

> Hi Travis,
>
>
>
> Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to
> trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice
> to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going
> out instead of having it be manual.
>
>
>
> So effectively, it should be:
>
>

>
> “Invoice Sent/Received”

>
>

> order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce
> Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

>

new_ticket.name: Rohan Kulkarni
new_ticket.description:
Hello,
This is a reminder to complete the documentation within the next 5 days.
Thanks,
Team Lead
new_ticket.title: Reminder: Task Pending
new_ticket.resolution_note:
1. Create a task or reminder in your preferred digital note-taking app or calendar.
2. Label the task as "Complete Documentation."
3. Set a due date and time that is reasonable for you to complete the documentation process.
4. Add any relevant details or notes to the task, such as specific sections you need to document or resources you may need.
5. Set the task to remind you at least a day before the due date to ensure you have ample time to complete the documentation.
6. When the reminder appears, pause your current task and dedicate time to work on the documentation.
7. Once completed, mark the task as done in your app or calendar.

By following these steps, you will effectively manage your documentation process and ensure it is completed in a timely manner.

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Urgent: Cloud Access Issue
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hello Team,

Please note that there is currently a Microsoft error affecting cloud re-access after being logged off or disconnected. Unfortunately, there is no available resolution time at the moment. We will keep you apprised once we receive an update.

If you are actively working in the cloud, you may continue, but please be aware that your workspace could be unstable. This means that if you're handling sensitive or collaborative documents, there is a risk that your progress might be lost. In such cases, if you encounter issues, consider shifting to non-sensitive or non-collaborative tasks.

If you are unable to access the cloud or your standard applications (e.g., RingCentral, Applied, Outlook, etc.), please log off and attempt to reconnect later in the day.

Thank you for your understanding and patience.
Thank you,
[cid:image001.png@01DB083B.A2907370]

I just got a report that our LOI automation is not working.

Please review.  Also, please get with @support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com<mailto:support.scottsdale@teamlogicit.com> to make sure all applicable websites are white listed so our SPAM filter doesn’t block any of these messages.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> we need to have a manual follow up system after we send LOI out via phone and/or text to confirm they have received it and sent if we have not heard from them.

Dan,

If this is about Jerry Thompson, I sent an email in that other thread. Jim
got and opened the email notification for the LOI being signed.

If it helps, we can set up an automation to email Jim and/or anyone else if
these email notifications have been opened and the agent's stage hasn't
been changed within a certain time frame.

If this is about another agent, please let me know so I can investigate it.

Travis Schenck

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: RE: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Hi Travis,

Carly needs to be added to this notification.  In addition, it needs to trigger an invoice to go out from accounting so we can send them an invoice to pay for the background check, etc.  Can we automate this invoice going out instead of having it be manual.

So effectively, it should be:

“Letter of Intent Signed”
“Invoice Sent/Received”
“Ready for Background Check & Business Plan”

In my mind this should all be automated. Carly or other representative would then review once they got the notification to make sure all is in order.  This will likely be easier once we have awareness via a Salesforce Dashboard which we are in the process of building out.

@Carly Garzella<mailto:carly@garzellagroup.com> please review.

Thanks,

similar_tickets_found.TITLE: Re: LOI Automation
similar_tickets_found.DESCRIPTION:
Dan,

I can have Carly added to that email notification no problem.

I spoke with Carly about the automatic invoice part before, and let her
know we would almost certainly need access to your QB Online to set up an
automatic invoice that's integrated with the rest of this flow. Would that
be alright with you?

As an alternative, we could set up an email notification to Jason with all
the info he'd need to generate and send an invoice. I know that's
not ideal, because it relies on someone manually doing it, but it is
another option.

Please let me know what you think.

Travis Schenck
